title: Option::unwrap() on a None value' with wrong import path

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code In Cargo.toml `bee-crypto = { git = "https://github.com/iotaledger/bee.git", branch = "dev" }` Then just add ```Rust pub enum Error { BeeCryptoError(bee_crypto::ternary::sponge::::Error), } ``` ### Meta ``` rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0 commit-date: 2021-03-23 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.51.0 LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` error: expected one of `,` or `>`, found keyword `as` --> src\main.rs:6:84 | 6 | BeeCryptoError(bee_crypto::ternary::sponge::::Error), | ^^ expected one of `,` or `>` | help: expressions must be enclosed in braces to be used as const generic arguments | 6 | BeeCryptoError(bee_crypto::ternary::sponge::<{ bee_crypto::ternary::sponge::Kerl as Sponge }>::Error), | ^ ^ error[E0412]: cannot find type `Error` in module `bee_crypto::ternary::sponge` --> src\main.rs:6:96 | 6 | BeeCryptoError(bee_crypto::ternary::sponge::::Error), | ^^^^^ not found in `bee_crypto::ternary::sponge` | help: consider importing one of these items | 1 | use bee_crypto::ternary::bigint::error::Error; | 1 | use core::fmt::Error; | 1 | use std::error::Error; | 1 | use std::fmt::Error; thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler\rustc_metadata\src\rmeta\decoder.rs:900:54 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [generics_of] computing generics of `bee_crypto::ternary::sponge` #1 [opt_const_param_of] computing the optional const parameter of `Error::BeeCryptoError::0::{constant#0}` end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler\rustc_metadata\src\rmeta\decoder.rs:900:54 stack backtrace: note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [generics_of] computing generics of `bee_crypto::ternary::sponge` #1 [opt_const_param_of] computing the optional const parameter of `Error::BeeCryptoError::0::{constant#0}` #2 [typeck] type-checking `Error::BeeCryptoError::0::{constant#0}` #3 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #4 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
